children.name: to reduce the number, amount, price, or size of st
reduce
children.definition: to make something less in amount or level: giảm
examples: ▪ I was hoping they would reduce the price a little.
reduced[adjective]được giảm
▪ Most airlines offer reduced prices for children.

children.name: greatly/significantly/dramatically reduce: giảm đáng kể
examples: ▪ You can greatly reduce your heating bills by using low-energy heaters.

children.name: dramatically/drastically reduce: giảm đột ngột, trầm trọng
examples: ▪ Their income has been drastically reduced.

children.name: reduce something by half/10%/2 years etc: Giảm cái gì đó một nửa / 10% / 2 năm vv
examples: ▪ The new road will reduce traffic through the town by 30%.
▪ Benefits will be reduced by $50 for each child who fails to attend school.

children.name: lower
children.definition: to reduce an amount, limit, or level - use this especially in writing about business or technical subjects: giảm
examples: ▪ After 20 minutes, lower the temperature to 200 degrees.
▪ The Bundesbank is under pressure to lower interest rates.

children.name: cut
children.definition: to reduce something by a lot, especially prices, time, or money: cắt giảm
examples: ▪ The new system is aimed at cutting the average waiting time.
cut something by half/several weeks/ten per cent etc
Cắt giảm cái gì đó một nửa / vài tuần / mười phần trăm vv
▪ Because of the recession, salaries in the advertising industry have been cut by a half.
▪ The mortgage insurance agency has cut costs by $2000 over the last 3 years, making it easier for people to buy homes.
cut something from/to something
Cắt giảm cái gì đó từ / sang cái gì đó
▪ His annual leave has been cut from six weeks to just three.

children.name: turn down
children.definition: to reduce the level of sound, heat, light etc, especially by turning a control: giảm xuống

children.name: turn something down:giảm xuống cái gì đó
examples: ▪ Could you turn the lights down - it’s too bright in here.

children.name: turn down something:giảm xuống cái gì đó
examples: ▪ The weather wasn’t as cold, so we decided to turn down the central heating.

children.name: turn something down slightly/a little/a bit:giảm xuống cái gì đó một chút
examples: ▪ Would you mind turning the volume down a little?

children.name: decrease
children.definition: to reduce something, especially by a fairly small amount or number: giảm xuống
examples: ▪ Various methods are being explored in order to decrease the volume of traffic on our roads.
▪ Better health education should help to decrease the incidence of heart disease.
▪ Use of the new nets has significantly decreased the number of dolphins killed accidentally each year.

children.name: slash
children.definition: to reduce prices by a very large amount - used especially in advertisements and newspapers: cắt bớt
examples: ▪ American car manufacturers have started slashing prices in an effort to stimulate sales.
▪ Public spending has been slashed over the past two years.
slash something by 10%/half/75% etc:cắt bớt cái gì đó10%/một nửa/75% ...
▪ Come to our Summer Sale, where prices have been slashed by up to 75%.

children.name: knock down
children.definition: to reduce the price of something by a large amount, especially in order to make it easier to sell: hạ, giảm giá

children.name: knock down something:hạ, giảm giá cái gì đó
examples: ▪ Shops are knocking down prices in an effort to increase sales.

children.name: knock something down:hạ, giảm giá cái gì đó
examples: ▪ In the end he knocked the price down to £70.

children.name: halve
children.definition: to reduce something by half: giảm một nửa
examples: ▪ The overseas aid budget has been almost halved, from $18m to just over $10m.

children.name: roll back
children.definition: to reduce prices: hạ, giảm giá

children.name: roll back something:hạ, giảm giá cái gì đó
examples: ▪ Most of the big downtown stores have rolled back their prices to dispose of winter stock.

children.name: roll something back:hạ, giảm giá cái gì đó
examples: ▪ Rather than roll prices back, the company negotiated pay increases that ranged between 10 and 15 percent.

children.name: to reduce pain, worry, or unpleasant feelings
reduce
children.definition: giảm bớt
examples: ▪ They gave him drugs to reduce the pain.
▪ Prompt action can often reduce the severity of shock in road accident victims.
▪ Miriam finds that yoga and meditation help her in reducing stress.

children.name: greatly/significantly/dramatically reduce:giảm bớt đáng kể
examples: ▪ Stopping smoking can significantly reduce your risk of suffering a heart attack.

children.name: lessen
children.definition: to slightly reduce pain or bad feelings: làm giảm đi
examples: ▪ He shifted his position a little, in order to lessen the pain in his leg.
▪ Everyone has their own ideas about the best way to lessen jet lag.
▪ Boys are more likely to smoke to relieve stress than girls are.

children.name: lighten
children.definition: to reduce the amount of work or worry that someone has: giảm bớt, làm nhẹ đi

children.name: lighten somebody’s load/workload:giảm bớt, làm nhẹ đi lượng công việc của ai đó
examples: ▪ Maybe we should hire another secretary to lighten Barbara’s workload.

children.name: relieve
children.definition: to make pain or feelings less unpleasant: làm nhẹ bớt, giảm bớt
examples: ▪ Peppermint has long been regarded as a plant that can relieve indigestion.
▪ Magnetic board games can help relieve the boredom of long car journeys for kids.
▪ Harry attempted a couple of jokes to relieve the tension of the occasion.

children.name: ease
children.definition: to reduce pain or unpleasant feelings and make someone feel happier or more comfortable: làm bớt căng
examples: ▪ Rod rubbed his jaw to ease the pain a little.
▪ The arrival of the others eased her embarrassment slightly.

children.name: alleviate
children.definition: to reduce pain, make a problem less serious, or reduce feelings such as being bored or anxious: làm dịu, làm khuây
examples: ▪ You can’t cure a common cold, but you can alleviate the symptoms.
▪ Western aid has helped to alleviate the situation in northern India.
alleviation/əˌliːviˈeɪʃən/ [uncountable noun]:sựlàm dịu, làm khuây
▪ the alleviation of pain

children.name: deaden/dull
children.definition: to reduce physical pain or emotional problems, especially with the result that you feel nothing at all: làm giảm, làm dịu, làm nhẹ
examples: ▪ They gave me a local anaesthetic to deaden the pain.
▪ It was impossible not to think about her baby, but the drugs dulled her panic.

children.name: take the edge off
children.definition: to make something such as pain, hunger, or a shock slightly less unpleasant or upsetting: làm bớt
examples: ▪ I took a couple of painkillers, which took the edge off the pain.
▪ Knowing that Peter was close by took the edge off my anxiety for my grandson.

children.name: allay
children.definition: Làm dịu

children.name: allay somebody’s fears/concern/suspicions etc : Làm dịu nỗi sợ hãi / lo lắng / nghi ngờ của ai đó vv
examples: formal to make someone much less frightened, concerned etc:
▪ The government is anxious to allay public fears over the safety of beef.
▪ Showing her his identity card went some way towards allaying her suspicions.

children.name: to reduce the amount of st that you eat, drink, or use
cut down
children.definition: if you cut down on food, alcoholic drink, or tobacco, you eat, drink, or smoke less of it, especially in order to lose weight or to improve your health: cắt giảm
examples: ▪ If you can’t give up smoking completely, at least try to cut down.

children.name: cut down on:cắt giảm
examples: ▪ I’m trying to cut down on meat.

children.name: reduce
children.definition: to reduce the amount of something that you eat, drink, or use. Reduce is more formal than cut down: giảm , hạ
examples: ▪ Doctors are urging people to reduce the amount of salt in their diet.
▪ Supermarkets can help promote healthy eating habits by reducing the amount of sugar and fat in their products.

children.name: when a company reduces its activities, the amount it spends etc
scale downalso scale back American
children.definition: to reduce something, such as the size of an organization or a plan, so that it is still operating but on a smaller level: giảm bớt

children.name: scale down/back something:giảm bớt cái gì đó
examples: ▪ European central banks have scaled down their operations in South Africa.

children.name: scale something down/back:giảm bớt cái gì đó
examples: ▪ The two companies have announced plans to scale back production next year.
▪ Development projects were scaled down, and some proposals for new buildings were put on hold.

children.name: cut back
children.definition: to reduce the numbers of something or the time or money spent on something, especially because you can no longer afford to continue at the previous level: Cắt giảm
examples: cutback/ˈkʌtbæk/ [countable noun]:sự cắt giảm
▪ Schools and hospitals could suffer as a result of government cutbacks.
cut back in :sự cắt giảm trong
▪ There has been a significant cutback in the defence budget this year.

children.name: cut back on:Cắt giảm trên
examples: ▪ Her friends know that she is under stress and have warned her to cut back on her workload.

children.name: cut back something: cắt giảm cái gì đó
examples: ▪ Our budget has been cut back this year.
▪ Farmers have agreed to cut back wheat production.

children.name: cut something back: Cắt giảm cái gì đó
examples: ▪ We have had to cut expenditure back in an effort to increase profits.

children.name: downsize/rightsize
children.definition: to reduce the number of people who work for a company, especially in order to save money: cắt giảm, thu hẹp
examples: ▪ They are downsizing the workforce in a desperate attempt to save the firm.
▪ Advised to rightsize its operation, the company has shrunk to 2,000 employees.

children.name: pare down
children.definition: to reduce something by small amounts over a period of time so that the effect is not very serious or noticeable while it is happening: giảm dần, bớt dần

children.name: pare down something:giảm dần, bớt dần cái gì đó
examples: ▪ The company has pared down expenditure and hopes to recoup its losses this year.

children.name: pare something down:giảm dần, bớt dần cái gì đó
examples: ▪ We have managed to pare our costs down to the absolute minimum.

children.name: rationalizealso rationalise British
children.definition: to try to make a company more effective by getting rid of unnecessary workers etc: tối ưu hóa
examples: ▪ We are a small company, and we need to rationalize if we want to compete in this market.
▪ The company has done a lot to rationalize production.

children.name: wind down
children.definition: to gradually reduce the work of a company or organization so that it can be closed down completely: giảm dần

children.name: wind something down:giảm dần cái gì đó
examples: ▪ The old sickness benefit system is slowly being wound down.

children.name: wind something down:giảm dần cái gì đó
examples: ▪ I want to return in a few years’ time - I’ve already started to wind the business down.

children.name: run down
children.definition: to deliberately make something such as a company, an industry, or a public service weaker and weaker, by giving it less and less money: làm đi xuống

children.name: run down something:làm cái gì đó đi xuống
examples: ▪ Opposition leaders are accusing the government of running down the Health Service.

children.name: run something down:làm cái gì đó đi xuống
examples: ▪ They buy up rival companies then just run them down.

children.name: trim
children.definition: to reduce something by a small amount that will not harm or change it very much, especially in order to save money: giảm bớt
examples: ▪ By trimming costs and improving service the hotel has now started to make a profit again.
trim something by 10% etc:giảm bớt cái gì đó 10%...
▪ The proposed bill would trim welfare spending by $5 billion.

children.name: streamline
children.definition: to reduce the costs of something such as a service or industry by employing fewer people, reducing the number of things you produce or provide etc - used especially in business contexts: tổ chức hợp lý hóa
examples: ▪ The government is once again attempting to streamline the health care service in order to pay for tax cuts.
▪ The company announced it was to streamline its operations and close down three factories in the UK.

children.name: to make a written or spoken statement less forceful
tone down
children.definition: to reduce the effect of a speech or piece of writing, especially by making the language you use less forceful: làm dịu bớt, hạ giọng

children.name: tone something down:làm dịu bớt, hạ giọng cái gì đó
examples: ▪ I felt my letter was worded too strongly, so I toned it down a bit.

children.name: tone down something:làm dịu bớt, hạ giọng cái gì đó
examples: ▪ Wagner was forced to tone down his remarks about his opponent when it became obvious that the attacks were costing him votes.

children.name: moderate
children.definition: to make your language more acceptable, especially by not swearing or being very rude: làm dịu đi, tiết chế
examples: ▪ We had to ask Joan to moderate her language in front of the kids.
▪ She apologized at once, and moderated her voice.

children.name: dilute
children.definition: to reduce the effect or force of an argument or belief, by accepting additional people, things, or ideas that may make it bigger but also weaker: làm giảm bớt
examples: ▪ Right wing groups are determined to dilute the influence of the trade unions.
▪ They felt that their original aims and demands were being diluted.

children.name: erode
children.definition: to gradually reduce the amount or value of something, especially money, wages, or profits over a period of time: bào mòn, ăn mòn
examples: ▪ Over the years, the value of our savings and investments has been eroded by inflation.

children.name: gradually/steadily erode:bào mòn, ăn mòn dần
examples: ▪ High interest rates can gradually erode profit margins.

children.name: eat into
children.definition: if costs, rising prices, etc eat into the amount of money you have, they reduce its value: dần dần ăn mòn
examples: ▪ Rising rents and travel expenses simply eat into any pay rise that nurses might get.
▪ Theft from offices and factories eats into company profits.

children.name: deplete
children.definition: to reduce the amount of something to a level that is too low: tháo, rút, xả hết ra
examples: ▪ Over the last few years, rainforests have been steadily depleted.
▪ He knew that the area’s rich plant life had been severely depleted by the huge herds of cows grazing the land.
▪ CFC is just one chemical that depletes the ozone layer.

children.name: chip away at
children.definition: to gradually reduce the strength of something by repeated small amounts: bắt đầu giảm
examples: ▪ High interest rates can chip away at your profits.
▪ The group continues to campaign for the rights of disabled people, chipping away at old prejudices.

children.name: whittle away
children.definition: to reduce something by small amounts over a period of time, so that the final effect is very serious: làm giảm đi

children.name: whittle away at:làm giảm đi
examples: ▪ Congress is whittling away at our civil liberties.

children.name: whittle away something:làm giảm đi cái gì đó
examples: ▪ Inflation has been whittling away the value of state pensions for the last fifteen years.

children.name: whittle something away:làm giảm đi cái gì đó
examples: ▪ Lawmakers have gradually whittled the program’s funding away over the last few years.

children.name: a reduction in number, prices, levels etc
reduction
children.definition: when a price, level etc is reduced - use this when something is reduced deliberately: sự giảm bớt
examples: ▪ We offer a reduction for groups of 10 or more.
reduction in:sự giảm bớt trong
▪ Cleaner fuel has contributed to a reduction in air pollution.
▪ a reduction in working hoursa reduction of £10/$5/5% etc
a reduction by a particular amount:sự giảm bớt một lượng cụ thể
▪ There were reductions of up to 50% in some stores.
a big/huge/massive reduction:sự giảm bớt lớn
▪ There has been a big reduction in the number of issues the president addresses in any given week.
price reduction
sự giảm bớt giá
▪ Several holiday firms are offering huge price reductions on winter holidays.

children.name: decrease
children.definition: when something happens less than it used to: sự giảm đi, giảm sút

children.name: decrease in:sự giảm đi, giảm sút trong
examples: ▪ There has been a 15% decrease in violent crime it has gone down by 15%.

children.name: a significant/marked decrease:sự giảm đi, giảm sút đáng kể
examples: ▪ In the last five years there has been a significant decrease in the number of deaths from heart disease.

children.name: drop /fall
children.definition: drop/fall/drɒpǁdrɑːp, fɔːl/  when a number or amount goes down suddenly or by a large amount: sự hạ, giảm, sụt
examples: drop/fall in:sự hạ, giảm, sụt trong
▪ Charities have reported a 25% fall in donations during the past year.
a sudden fall/drop:sự hạ, giảm, sụt đột ngột
▪ Universities are reporting a sudden drop in the number of students studying science subjects.
a sharp fall/drop:sự hạ, giảm, sụt đột ngột
▪ This year we have seen a sharp fall in profits.
dropnounLOWER
[ C usually singular ]a reduction in the amount or level of something
_The recent dropinmagazine subscriptions is causing some concern.

children.name: cut
children.definition: a reduction in the amount or size of something made by a government or large organization - use this especially for talking about politics or business: sự cắt giảm
examples: cut in:sự cắt giảm trong
▪ Cuts in the education budget have led to fewer teachers and larger classes.
a big/drastic cut:sự cắt giảm lớn
▪ There are to be big cuts in the health budget next year.
pay/job/tax cuts :sự cắt giảm lương/biên chế/thuế
cuts in wages, number of jobs, or taxes
▪ Nurses are protesting about further pay cuts.
▪ The new management has promised that there will be no job cuts.
